overview: Luis has set up 2 companies and has extensive experience in dealing with early stage companies and private equity investing. In 2002 he set up IDFC Private Equity. He was earlier a Partner at ChrysCapital. Prior to that, he spent 11 years in sales and trading and was a key member of the start-up team at HDFC Bank, Indiaâ€™s leading private sector bank. He has also worked at HSBC Markets, Citibank, KPMG and PriceWaterhouse. Luis is currently a Director of the Emerging Markets Private Equity Association (EMPEA) and is on the Board of Governors of the Centre for Fuel Studies and Research. He chairs the Asia Cabinet of the Global Advisory Board of the Graduate School of Business, University of Chicago. Luis has been involved with many industry-related committees over the past 15 years. Luis received an MBA from the University of Chicago (where he won the Deanâ€™s Award for Distinction and was actively involved in creating the only mandatory course at the business school) and an MCom from the University of Mumbai. He is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) and was a rank-holder at the ICAI examinations and at the MCom Part I. Luis is married and has 2 kids. He likes to unwind on the weekend, hanging out with his kids and teaching Sunday School.
